isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 2000 4000 and 8000 MODELS BUILT OCTOBER 1, 1998 AND AFTER - ALLISON WT TRANSMISSION WITH WTEC III ELECTRONIC CONTROLS - DESCRIPTION - DIAGNOSTIC TELLTALES

svcproc.title: DIAGNOSTIC TELLTALES
svcproc.para: Several diagnostic features are included in the electronic control system to assist in troubleshooting malfunctions and/or to monitor specific operating parameters. These features include a CHECK TRANS light on the instrument panel and the Data Link Connector for using an electronic service tool. When a malfunction is detected in the control system, a series of "diagnostic codes" are used to identify and clarify the nature of the malfunction.

CHECK TRANS light - The red CHECK TRANS light is located in the instrument cluster. A system check is performed when turning the ignition key to the on position to start the vehicle. The CHECK TRANS light is activated until the vehicle is started, then it will deactivate, unless a system fault is detected by the ECU.

If a system fault that inhibits the transmission operation is detected by the ECU, the CHECK TRANS light will illuminate, accompanied by eight seconds of short beeps from the shift selector, indicating that transmission shifts are being restricted. The SELECT digit on the shift display will be blank. Vehicle operation may continue in order to reach service assistance. The ECU may not respond to shift selector requests, since operating limitations are being placed on the transmission; i.e., upshifts and downshifts may be restricted. Directional changes (forward to reverse for example) will not occur.

Any time the CHECK TRANS light has been illuminated, the ECU will register a diagnostic code. It may be identified on the shifter display (discussed in TROUBLESHOOTING) and/or using an electronic service tool.
Minor conditions can occur that will cause a diagnostic code to be registered in the ECU, but will not illuminate the CHECK TRANS light or restrict transmission operation.

DATA LINK CONNECTOR - The data link connector is used to connect an electronic service tool to the transmission electronic control system. The electronic service tool diagnostic codes and other related information will be discussed in the TROUBLESHOOTING section.
